title: Is Graph Bipartite?
content:
Given an undirected , return  if and only if it is bipartite.
Recall that a graph is bipartite if we can split its set of nodes into two independent subsets A and B, such that every edge in the graph has one node in A and another node in B.
The graph is given in the following form:  is a list of indexes  for which the edge between nodes  and  exists.  Each node is an integer between 0 and .  There are no self edges or parallel edges:  does not contain , and it doesn't contain any element twice.
 






 






All the values of  are unique.
The graph is guaranteed to be undirected.
